title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message:
Hi,

This board came in with no image. Unfortunately my colleague went ahead and reflowed the GPU to diagnose this board before we spotted that this is notorious board for C9560 problem. Now we have an image but question is did a temporary fix to GPU or to a cap? Is there a way to check it before we replace both?

Thanks!

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Just replace the cap and see if it doesn't come back.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Okay. Will post here later if it comes back.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Replaced the cap. Put on Video stress test. Black image and system freeze after half an hour. GPU next?

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: What did you use for video testing? I find that Furmark never crashes after replacing C9560 and Heaven just always crashes no matter what.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: I use Cinebench for quick CPU and GPU test and FURMARK for long stress test. Now it doesnt even want to boot -> black screen. Back to the original problem before GPU reflow.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Not wanting to boot is not a common GPU issue. Does it still chime? Vcore?

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Agreed. That is why I am not jumping straight to GPU replacement on this one. No chime on boot and no image only fan spin. NVRAM reset doesnt work. This morning I was able to boot it again but it crashed in Furmark immediately.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: Could be anything. Vcore present when board does not boot? Bad RAM slot?

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message:
Tried using single ram in different slot - no success
GPU VCORE - present
CPU VCORE -  present

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: I wouldn't bother with this one as it could be anything. But if you have time to waste the common issue is the MUX and/or GPU/VRAM.

title: 820-2850-A Video problems
message: No sir, I am a very busy man. Topic closed.
